page.title: 13HISTORIC BUILDINGS
page.content:
The South-East corner, which has a spectacular view to the South Downs, has the site of Anstiebury Camp, dating from l800 B.C. It has been excavated by archaeologists in recent years. The only reference available is from a previous 'dig': "Hanstie or Anstie Bury" by R. A. C. Godwin-Austin published by Wyman & Sons in "Surrey Archeological Collection", Volume 5, pages 2l - 23.
However, a local archivist states that this and Holmbury Camp were probably built as defence fortifications against an invasion by Julius Ceasar and date from the first century B.C. An article on this subject by F.H. Thompson appears in the Antiquaries Journal for 1979, page 245.
